iso_retirement.name: Southern Zhuang
iso_retirement.remedy: Split into five languages: Nong Zhuang [zhn]; Yang Zhuang [zyg]; Yongnan Zhuang [zyn]; Zuojiang Zhuang [zzj]; Dai Zhuang [zhd].
iso_retirement.comment:
These five Southern Zhuang languages are not mutually intelligible with each
other and have no common literature. They have been grouped into the same
official nationality (Zhuang) since 1958 by the government (along with speakers
of ccx, Northern Zhuang,

and Buyang), but previously did not share a common ethnolinguistic identity.
There is no central variety or reference dialect for all five either (most
commonly some dialect of Chinese is used as lingua franca among speakers of
different Southern Zhuang langauges).
